title-group.article-title: On the Numerical Computation of Parabolic Problems for Preceding Times

abstract.p: We develop and analyze a general procedure for computing selfadjoint parabolic problems backwards in time, given an a priori bound on the solutions. The method is applicable to mixed problems with variable coefficients which may depend on time. We obtain error bounds which are naturally related to certain convexity inequalities in parabolic equations. In the time-dependent case, our difference scheme discerns three classes of problems. In the most severe case, we recover a convexity result of Agmon and Nirenberg. We illustrate the method with a numerical experiment.
